text: Jake holds his phone and dials the number.
Good morning, TechLine customer service. How can I help you?
Hello, my name’s Jake Vella. I bought a new phone yesterday, but it doesn’t turn on.
The clerk types on her computer.
Yes, of course. I’ve got the warranty too. Its number is 4529.
Clerk checks the details on the screen.
Thank you. Did you charge the phone before turning it on?
Yes, I charged it for two hours, but nothing happened.
Clerk nods and offers a solution.
I understand. Please bring the phone to our service centre. We’ll check or replace it for free.
That’s great, thank you. Where is the service centre?
It’s on Main Street, next to the post office. We’re open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Thank you very much for your help.
Both smile; the call ends politely.
You’re welcome. Have a nice day.
